title: The End of League
body: Lately ive realized that league has completely thrown its die hard fans away. Remember the fun MOBA where you could be as toxic as you wanted? it was so much fun being able to have fun and not worry about anybody reporting you because they had a bad game. literally anything gets you banned nowadays. What a shame because league had the potential to become the most popular game. Sucks they wanted to cater to their baby audience and completely bone their stans.

>**Trash talk is part of all competitive sports. It happens all the time in the pros.**

>Yes and no. Yes, trash talk occurs, but it has definite limits. Most of the things that are punished in game (racial, ethnic and homophobic slurs, sexism, etc.) would also earn you a hefty fine in professional sports.

>A Tumblr List of NBA Fines (http://nbafines.tumblr.com/)
(My personal favorite on that site is this indefinite suspension (http://nbafines.tumblr.com/post/1010368028/3-12-96-the-nba-suspended-mahmoud-abdul-rauf-den), simply for refusing to stand during the National Anthem.)

>NBC Article on Fines Agreed to by the NFLPA (http://profootballtalk.nbcsports.com/2012/12/01/bizarrely-specific-nfl-fines-come-from-agreed-league-union-schedule/)
"Excessive profanity or other unsportsmanlike conduct triggers a minimum fine of $10,500."

>NHL Office of Player Safety (http://www.nhl.com/ice/eventhome.htm?location=/playersafety)
Brendan Shanahan is the ****ing Bad Santa of the NHL. Did you know that his Office of Player Safety watches every minute of every game, from multiple angles? He sees and hears EVERYTHING, including swearing.

>... and the grand finale!
Marge Schott (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marge_Schott), who was forced out of ownership of the Cincinnati Reds for racist comments and pro-Nazi sentiments.

P.S. You still have yet to post your entire unedited chat logs to back up your claim of being falsely banned despite multiple people asking you to do so [in your previous thread](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/XE0pEWvk-why-i-should-be-unbanned).

And even while emotions get high, you can remain civil.

"Trash talk" is nothing more than a euphemism for "I'm not having fun, so I have to ruin other players' game too so nobody can have fun!"

*League* has grown every year, with a *very* slight decline in 2017 -- to 81 million players per month. Even if they lost FIFTY PERCENT of their playerbase they'll still well into the top 20 most played games, and doing fine both player-base wise and financially.
Jw, where did you find those stats? I can never find updated stuff that riots put out.

RIOT very rarely publishes anything regarding their player base and similar stuff. If you try googling things like "league of legends player base" you will find some sites were they have previous official RIOT stats.
Yea, just from the wording of the comment I thought djinn had found some official ones.

Actually, the player base decline was quite big in 2016. From around 100 million it fall to 81, if i remember correctly, which is around 20%.

Thats not the point though. As you said, League has been growing and will keep growing. In fact, League's market share is extremely big compared to any other MOBAs, i think its around 40% or maybe higher. So, yeah, even if it were to lose half of its player base, it would be on the top 3. 

Will League die? Some day it will. Thats inevitable. It might happen if RIOT releases LoL 2, or maybe when a way better game appears. But, nonetheless, we got a pretty long time before that happens.

I certainly do not remember that kind of fun.
I remember when we had a 3rd party program on Frozen Thrones maps when DotA was popular. We'd banned those players who were toxic in our game while TDA clan was running it. We never tolerated toxicity. It was hard for these players to get into a TDA game because you had to be a certain level with a certain MMR score in order to. This was back in 2005, possibly sooner.

The internet has always been a toxic place, as all video games with open communication. 
Now League has this same policy, but stricter than I was when I was a MOD for TDA clan. I approve of the system and I'd change nothing.

Now, as for your claim, the game is dying.. The number of times I've seen people say the same thing over and over again for the past 10 years, seeing the League population go past 3 million players, and players says "the game is dead" because they didn't like how the character was designed or they lost their ranked games, or they were banned. Then 5 years later, another 10 million players join this game, and people like yourself say "the game is dying". Then another 2 more years we're at 25 million players are playing. 

And here you are. 
As thousands before you have said, "this game is dying". 
It may be the end of league for you, but this game will be around for a very very long time for us and the company. For MANY years to come.
